DataElement.preferredName: Personal Medical History Urothelial Carcinoma Ureter Or Prostatic Urethra Diagnosis Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to whether there is a diagnosis of a personal medical history of urothelial carcinoma in the ureter or prostatic urethra.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Personal Medical History Urothelial Carcinoma Ureter Or Prostatic Urethra Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._A malignant neoplasm derived from the transitional epithelium of the urinary tract (urinary bladder, ureter, urethra, or renal pelvis). It is frequently papillary._The thick-walled tube that carries urine from each kidney to the bladder._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._That part of the male urethra that passes through the prostate gland._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.
A carcinoma arising from the urothelial lining of the urinary tract (bladder, renal pelvis, ureter, or urethra).

Concepts.definition: The thick-walled tube that carries urine from each kidney to the bladder.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
That part of the male urethra that passes through the prostate gland.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
